items.quote: we note that the acquisition of Xilinx should add net cash of about $	ext{	extdollar} 2.2$ billion

items.summary: AMD's cash was $5.91 billion at the end of 2022.
items.quote: AMD's cash was $	ext{	extdollar} 5.91$ billion at the end of 2022,

items.summary: Cash was $3.61 billion at the end of 2021.
items.quote: Cash was $	ext{	extdollar} 3.61$ billion at the end of 2021,

items.summary: Cash was $2.29 billion at the end of 2020.
items.quote: Cash was $	ext{	extdollar} 2.29$ billion at the end of 2020,

items.summary: Total debt was $2.47 billion as of the end of 2022.
items.quote: Total debt was $2.47 billion as of the end of 2022.

items.summary: Net cash was $3.45 billion at the end of 2022.
items.quote: Net cash was $3.45 billion at the end of 2022.

items.summary: Cash flow from operations was $3.57 billion in 2022.
items.quote: Cash flow from operations was $3.57 billion in 2022.

items.summary: AMD announced an $8 billion share-repurchase authorization in May 2022.
items.quote: In May 2022, AMD announced an $8 billion share-repurchase authorization;

items.summary: AMD does not expect to pay a dividend in 2023 or 2024.
items.quote: We do not expect AMD to pay a dividend in 2023 or 2024.

items.summary: Lisa Su became CEO in October 2014.
items.quote: Lisa Su became CEO in October 2014;

items.summary: Jean Hu is joining AMD as CFO in January 2023.
items.quote: In January 2023, AMD announced that long-time finance industry professional Jean Hu is joining the company as CFO.

items.summary: Devinder Kumar is retiring as CFO.
items.quote: She replaces Devinder Kumar, who is retiring.

items.summary: The analyst believes the new hire will enhance AMD's leadership team.
items.quote: we believe she will benefit the already strong leadership team at AMD.

items.summary: Saeied Moshkelani is the SVP and GM of the Client Compute Group at AMD.
items.quote: Saeied Moshkelani is SVP and GM of Client Compute Group.

items.summary: The pandemic has reversed the structural decline in PCs.
items.quote: The pandemic has turned around what had been structural decline in PCs.

items.summary: AMD is positioned for market share gains at Intel's expense.
items.quote: AMD appears positioned for market share gains at the expense of Intel.

items.summary: The acquisition of Xilinx carries multiple risks.
items.quote: The acquisition of Xilinx for $ 35 billion carries multiple risks.

items.summary: The all-stock nature of the Xilinx deal eliminates debt burden risks.
items.quote: The all-stock nature of the deal also eliminates the potential for a cumbersome debt burden.

items.summary: The deal has diluted AMD's share base but is acquiring higher-margin assets.
items.quote: The deal has diluted the share base, but AMD is acquiring growing and higher-margin assets that should not be dilutive to EPS.

items.summary: A general economic downturn poses a risk for AMD and other semiconductor companies.
items.quote: A main risk for AMD, as for other semiconductor companies, is the possibility of a general economic downturn.

items.summary: AMD is expected to weather economic challenges and emerge stronger.
items.quote: We believe that AMD has the financial strength, market leadership, and growth characteristics to weather this storm and emerge a stronger player.

items.summary: The percentage of hours worked away from the office is expected to increase.
items.quote: We also believe the percentage of hours worked away from the office will continue to increase.

items.summary: Increased remote work is expected to drive long-term demand for AMD products.
items.quote: That should drive long-term demand for personal PCs served by AMD CPUs, for data center CPUs to manage fast-growing data traffic, and for GPUs for gaming applications.

items.summary: AMD is investing in nontraditional businesses.
items.quote: AMD has been betting heavily on nontraditional businesses, including embedded, micro-server, and semi-custom (gaming console).

items.summary: AMD is the second-largest player in x86-based microprocessors.
items.quote: Advanced Micro Devices is the number-two player in x86-based microprocessors, behind Intel.

items.summary: AMD acquired Xilinx in 2021 to expand its presence in embedded computing and data centers.
items.quote: In 2021, Advanced Micro Devices acquired Xilinx, expanding its presence in embedded computing and data center.

items.summary: AMD shares are trading at 21.5 times the 2023 non-GAAP EPS estimate.
items.quote: AMD shares are trading at 21.5 -times our 2023 non-GAAP EPS estimate.

items.summary: AMD trades at a two-year forward P/E of 18.1.
items.quote: AMD trades at a two-year forward P/E of 18.1.

items.summary: The two-year-forward relative P/E of AMD is 1.05, above the market P/E.
items.quote: The two-year-forward relative P/E of 1.05 is just above the market P/E.

items.summary: Historical comparable valuation for AMD indicates value in the low $200s.
items.quote: Historical comparable valuation for AMD indicates value in the low $200s.

items.summary: Peer analysis suggests AMD should trade at a premium to peers.
items.quote: Peer group analysis suggests that AMD deserves to trade at a premium to peers on absolute and relative P/E.

items.summary: The peer-indicated value for AMD is in the $90s, down from a late 2021 peak.
items.quote: our peer-indicated value is in the $90s, down from a late 2021 peak in the $160s due to the 2022 peer-group selloff.

items.summary: The discounted free cash flow model suggests a fair value in the $150s.
items.quote: Our discounted free cash flow model renders a fair value in the $150s.

items.summary: The blended valuation approaches suggest a value above $150.
items.quote: Blending these approaches, we arrive at a value above $150.

items.summary: The client market is likely to remain volatile in the near term.
items.quote: While the client market is likely to remain volatile in the near term.

items.summary: AMD's EPYC is making progress in cloud and enterprise data centers.
items.quote: we are encouraged by the progress of EPYC in cloud and enterprise data center.

items.summary: The success of Ryzen CPUs is noted for desktop and notebook PCs.
items.quote: the success of Ryzen CPUs for desktop and notebook PCs.

items.summary: The outlook for AMD's Radeon GPUs in PC gaming is positive.
items.quote: the outlook for AMD's Radeon GPUs in the PC gaming.

items.summary: The XLNX deal is regarded as a logical next step for AMD.
items.quote: We regard the XLNX deal as a logical next step in AMD's journey.

items.summary: AMD is focusing on high-growth complementary assets for growth in cloud and non-technology markets.
items.quote: high-growth complementary assets that will accelerate AMD's growth in the cloud data center and high-value-added nontechnology markets.

items.summary: AMD's stock has declined due to softness in consumer demand.
items.quote: Like many Technology stocks, AMD has slipped from its highs on consumer demand softness.

items.summary: Current prices do not reflect AMD's revenue and margin growth potential.
items.quote: Current prices in our view do not fully reflect AMD's revenue and margin growth potential, and ongoing market share gains at Intel's expense.

items.summary: The analyst maintains a BUY rating for AMD with a target price of $100.
items.quote: We are reiterating our BUY rating to a 12-month target price of $100.

items.summary: On February 1, AMD traded at $80.48, an increase of $5.33.
items.quote: On February 1 at midday, BUY-rated AMD traded at $80.48, up $5.33.

items.summary: Argus Research was founded by Harold Dorsey in 1934.
items.quote: Argus Research, founded by Economist Harold Dorsey in 1934

items.summary: Argus uses a six-point system for analysis.
items.quote: This six-point system includes Industry Analysis, Growth Analysis, Financial Strength Analysis, Management Assessment, Risk Analysis and Valuation Analysis.

items.summary: Industry Analysis identifies industries expected to perform well over the next one-to-two years.
items.quote: the Industry Analysis identifies industries expected to perform well over the next one-to-two years.

items.summary: The Growth Analysis generates proprietary estimates for companies under coverage.
items.quote: The Growth Analysis generates proprietary estimates for companies under coverage.

items.summary: Financial Strength Analysis studies ratios to understand profitability, liquidity, and capital structure.
items.quote: In the Financial Strength Analysis, analysts study ratios to understand profitability, liquidity and capital structure.

items.summary: Management Assessment involves meeting with corporate management teams.
items.quote: During the Management Assessment, analysts meet with and familiarize themselves with the processes of corporate management teams.

items.summary: Risk Analysis assesses quantitative trends and qualitative threats.
items.quote: Quantitative trends and qualitative threats are assessed under the Risk Analysis.

items.summary: Valuation Analysis integrates a historical ratio matrix, discounted cash flow modeling, and peer comparison.
items.quote: Argus' Valuation Analysis model integrates a historical ratio matrix, discounted cash flow modeling, and peer comparison.

items.summary: Argus uses three ratings for stocks: BUY, HOLD, and SELL.
items.quote: Argus uses three ratings for stocks: BUY, HOLD, and SELL.

items.summary: A BUY-rated stock is expected to outperform the S&P 500 on a risk-adjusted basis over 12 months.
items.quote: A BUY-rated stock is expected to outperform the S&P 500 on a risk-adjusted basis over a 12-month period.

items.summary: A HOLD-rated stock is expected to perform in line with the S&P 500.
items.quote: A HOLD-rated stock is expected to perform in line with the S&P 500.

items.summary: A SELL-rated stock is expected to underperform the S&P 500.
items.quote: A SELL-rated stock is expected to underperform the S&P 500.
